reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise
reviews.text: I had a conference at this hotel, and I was not expecting much considering that it is on campus. I was immediately impressed by the professionalism of the front desk staff. The lobby is striking and sophisticated, especially for Columbus. The location is unbeatable if you have any business to attend to on campus. I imagine it would be fantastic for a football game, considering the stadium is just across the street. The rooms were nice, and all of the food was fantastic. I would definitely stay there again.

Very good university owned hotel at a not so good university. Great location - right by the business school and the football stadium. Average/below average food. Excellent rooms - very well appointed.
reviews.title: Great university hotel

reviews.text: Who would have guessed a hotel on a state university campus could be so fine? The Blackwell impressed me with the sleek design of the place: all Prairie School style (or inspired by it) woodwork and the like.
reviews.title: Much more than you'd expect from a state university

reviews.text: My room had a kingsize bed with good pillows (always important!). The hotel also provides free ethernet connections from the rooms and in lobby areas. Apparently wireless access is also available.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a meetig!

reviews.text: Thanks to the campus location, the hotel is quiet, too. It may be away from the attractions of downtown, but anyone here for the conference facilities attached or to see a game at the OSU stadium a stone's throw away will be pleased by the location.
reviews.title: Not bad...especially for Columbus

reviews.text: I have stayed here a number of times and I really love this hotel. The restaurant is especially good.
reviews.title: Too much fluff

reviews.text: My biggest complaint is the pillows. I know this may sound strange, but these monsters are so big and stiff that I still have a pinched nerve from a month ago. This is honestly true, which is what led me to write this review. When I was there I called down to see if there were any smaller sizes and the answer was an incredulous "no".
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!!

reviews.text: This also leads me to the reception desk staff. Everywhere in the hotel the staff is super friendly and courteous but the reception staff is fairly dismissive.
reviews.title: Nice facility not so nice service

reviews.text: But where else are you going to stay in Columbus?
reviews.title: super value!!!!

reviews.text: This is probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. I booked my one night stay at the Blackwell after reading the glowing reviews on this site and I was still surprised at how nice the hotel was, especially in regards to their nightly rates ($109-$139 range).
reviews.title: Luxury I was not expecting!!

reviews.text: One of our favorite trips is coming back to Ohio State to visit. This hotel is perfect for that. The exact ambiance for alumni, but not unwelcoming if you are from Michigan. There is a hotel up the street that booms fight songs in the lobby, and guests jeer if you are not wearing scarlet and gray, so this was a nice, elegant change. We chose it because of an alumni package, but as it turns out, the rate was not available because of a special event. Room was incredible, great view of stadium from Room 808. We also may have received extra amenities or service because we were on the Executive level. We did have a disturbing episode around the wait list for one of these suites, which were not available when I originally called. I was told I would be called if one opened up, which they said would be quite likely because there were only three of us. A couple days later, I called in again, and was given the opportunity to book the room without them knowing who I was. Therefore, the wait list people were not callled to be told of the opening like was promised and assured. For me, it was no problem, I ended up getting the room I wanted, but was misled about it, and had to initiate myself. I think the problem came because students are doing a lot of the work, and reservationist was new. I want to thank Emily for smoothing things over, and trying to explain things. It is a remarkable level of service they are providing, if indeed, most are students. Very friendly and professional staff. It was fairly expensive (over 200), so we couldnt afford this often, but very convenient to be on campus. Other more reasonable hotels still within walking,but none right on campus. Excellent toiletries!!!
reviews.title: The Best Experience - great stay!

reviews.text: Stayed here one night for an interview at Ohio State...nice, well managed hotel, friendly staff, clean and sharp looking rooms...restaurant on site is also very good. Self pay visitor parking only a 2-3 min. walk away.
reviews.title: Definitely recommended

reviews.text: I am staying at the Blackwell Hotel for a business conference, my meetings ended early, at 12 Noon, and I was hoping to get a nap in before doing some work with a colleague later in the afternoon, but they have ongoing construction on several floors, including a loud and annoying drill and hammer literally just above my room. Furthermore, they are building a large parking garage next door during the day as well.
reviews.title: Don't Stay here right now, lots of construction noise during day.

reviews.text: I was told that I should've been told about the construction, but that is not the case. Lastly, and this is why the hotel is stupid, they put a sign in the foyer of the 6th floor where the construction is taking place, but failed to additionally inform hotel guests on the 5th floor, where I am staying right now. Duh! Someone hammering on the floor apparently doesn't get heard thru the ceiling.......hmmm.....
reviews.title: Excellent in all respects

reviews.text: My room is ok, but the towel bar in the bathroom is broken.
reviews.title: The Blackwell is really swell!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was everything the reviews said it would be. All the staff at the hotel were wonderful. They were always accomodating with everything we asked for. Anytime I said thank you, I always heard "my pleasure" and it showed that they meant it.
reviews.title: Loved The Blackwell

likes.liked: — The beautiful room and the accomodation staff.

reviews.text: My husband and I went to an expo for the weekend and they brought us to the Convention Center and picked us up. Everytime we got in a car with a driver, they were always friendly and talkative. They always pointed out places as we drove by, told us about the city or about the college.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We thought that we would miss out on all the action not staying at a hotel close to the convention center, but we found that it was nice to be a little further away. As crazy as the weekend was, such as the Presidential candidates just leaving town and the Arnold Classics, they kept up with it all.
reviews.title: Superb

likes.liked: — The cleanliness and the rec center

reviews.text: Kudos to the Blackwell. I would stay again in a heartbeat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, especially for one that is associated with a college campus. I was there for business, and this is the hotel that they booked for me. Amenities were nice, staff was young (I think they are college students), friendly, and helpful. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which is standard hotel fare. Room was spacious, neat, and clean. You can only valet park, which is about $15. Self-parking is cheaper, but you have to walk a bit. My room was also designed to accommodate travelers with disabilities. I did not have a tub, so water got all over the floor, but I think it is supposed to be that way. I also did not have any counter space to put my toiletries anywhere. I had to use the counter in the other room. I Would stay there again, if I were visiting Columbus.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise!
